Great acting by all the actors especially Shannon Elizabeth. Good movie for teens and adults a like. Go see it! A lot of funny scenes.

Review title: an all around great must-see movie
Review_body: An shockingly hilarious movie that may end up as one of the great teenage sexual angst films of all time.  I was squirming in my seat laughing from the very first scene until the end.  Beyond the sexual humor, American Pie contains sweet stories of teenagers finding love.  Fabulous performances by the entire cast especially Jason Biggs, who is so believable as a sexually frustrated and confused teenager.  Chris Klein is so charming, especially in his singing scenes.   A brilliant movie!

Most comments I have read about this film point out only the "gross-out" elements.  What people seem to be missing is this is one of the most realistic films dealing with the subject of teenage sexuality.  Yes, some scenes are juvenile.  However, the film also portrays safe sex and realistic sex--not the usual "acceptable" Hollywood sex (Jack and Rose have sex after knowing each other for only two days in Titanic, where were the Puritan critics then?).  It seems sex is only OK in films if it is glamorous and has no mention of condoms.  As a 23 year old female, I appreciated the realistic portrayal of high school boys as I remember--horny and clueless.  However, these boys do learn some respect for women, at least more than they had at the beginning of the film; and, the girls do not allow them to get away with their disrespect and juvenile actions.  I think this is not a bad film for high schoolers, as it contains no violence and is actually quite entertaining.

Review title: I went to this movie because someone said it was funnier than TSA Mary.
Review_body: TSA Mary was funnier.  This was Porky's, Weird Science, the Graduate, and Fast Times at Ridgemont High, all rolled into one. I guess it's been a week since this movie's been opened in Silicon Valley, and this movie was actually sold out at the showing I watched.  The laughs were very few for a packed house.  Comments from the person I was with? She told me that the movie was just "alright for a matinee."  Thank God I only paid for this movie at half the price.
Hilariously funny!IMHO, considerably more enjoyable that the closest genre comparison 'There's Something About Mary'.In particular, look out for Nightmare Dad...Aargh!

Review title: A must see movie for anyone regardless of age
Review_body: This movie was excellent.I admit that I didn't even want to go see it at first,but agreed because it was my husbands turn to choose the movie.I was so happy that we went too!If you haven't seen the movie and don't want it spoiled do not read any further. It is your typical group of boys in high school (even though I never knew any seniors who were virgins!) who have made a pact to lose their virginity before graduation.One has a reluctant girlfriend who is saving herself for the one who loves her,another has the worse pick up lines you have ever heard,bachelor number three is a ball of nerves when it comes to women,and number four is a very shy almost nerdy kind of guy. Unlike some movies that have been out there,you tend to like these guys even though they just want to get deflowered.It is a hysterical movie that I think everyone should see,young and old,as long as you are of mature age because obviously it has many many references to sex and such. This movie,no doubt,will be a classic!

This is an honest film.  The opening scene shows exactly what it's all about and if you don't like it you can leave by the door you came in.  It's that simple.  This film is about real teenagers.  For almost every charecter in the film I could name of one my friends that could call that part their lifestory.  This film is extremly funny but if you can't take crude humour then it's not the film for you...sorry.  The soundtrack is also 100% and the guest appearance by Blink182 rounds the whole thing off perfectly (though what that monkey was all about is anyones guess).  Watch this with a load of friends!

I did not like American Pie at all!  It is a very sick movie.  It tells people especially teenagers one thing: to do it.  I think anyone who likes this movie needs their heads examined.  What is wrong with this world?  No wonder people are getting STDs and stuff.  I think movies need to show people doing it ONLY IF THEY ARE MARRIED!

Review title: The funniest film of the year!!!
Review_body: Being somewhat cautious about watching this film due to the overhyping of the extremely poor blairwitch project , i did feel the americans were going to do it again . Laud about something that really doesn't deserve it . I was wrong , this film was easily the funniest film i had seen this year and lived up to all the hype i had heard . Although the humour was smut riddled and the toilet based humour was putting There's something about mary to shame , the whole film worked and certainly gave us a Porky's or Screwballs for the millenium . The actors carried their parts of with ease and gave the viewer a squirm factor not felt for a long time . Nothing more to say except for we want m

I heard a lot of hype about this movie before I saw it.  About how these people would be the new "brat pack."  Nothing could be further from the truth.  It was a boring, poorly acted, unfunny film.  I have nothing against "gross" comedy, in fact I love it when it's done well.  However, it was used so stupidly in this movie.  It was as if the writers said, "okay, how far can we go?  That'll be cool.  People will be shocked!"  What's the point of shocking somebody if you have nothing interesting to say?  Sad movie.  The one saving grace was the dad's performance.  Everything else was a total mess.  The pie scene wasn't even funny!

This is a great movie.  I saw the unrated version on video and it was great with no scene compromise to get a specific rating.  Keep in mind those are young people and this may me shocking for some parents to imagine what's going on in their kids head at that age!  Many actors were unknown but since they were kids playing kids the ensemble was very natural.The pie scene is unforgettable.  There was a toilet scene "a la" dumb and dumber wich is always hillarious because most of us can relate on some way or another!The movie is very easy to watch and you're guaranteed to get a laugh every 3-5 minutes.

After all the hype and advertising, I really expected something better.  It reminded me of a somewhat modern day Porky's sort of movie.  Cute, but I think a bit over rated in the media.  I did, however, purchase the DVD so obviously thought it was good enough.

What a terrible disappointment this movie turned out to be!
Movies like Dumb and Dumber, Kingpin, Flying High, Spaceballs etc. etc. belong to my favorite movies of all time, so I was looking forward to this so much. But this movie never even came close to those classics.
What made the other movies so good was that even though the jokes were stupid, there was a sort of cleverness in them. This movie lacked that cleverness all together. Almost all jokes were predictable and therefore not very funny.Also a lot of the story lines and jokes seemed to be derived from old jokes of other movies, which made them less funny because they weren't new.Highlight of the movie for me was the 'Shermanator'. This kid reminded me of Anthony Michael Hall is his young years, and almost singlehandedly saved the movie for me.So all in all not a terribly bad movie, but certainly not a great one.

This movie was super funny and very realistic. It reminds me of my younger brother,wich he claims to identified himself like the character "Jim". My whole family loved that movie. Especially my uncle Alfonso Cardoso.

This film was hyped up so much that it was impossible for it to live up to expectations. However, friends who saw it said it was "hilarious" and so I was quite eager to see it.This film, in the main, is not "hilarious." It has several very funny moments, but with a premise such as this (teenage boys seeking to lose their virginity) you'd think there would have been many more funny moments. That's not to say that the writers were stingy with the jokes, but rather that only a small proportion of the gags were actually laugh-aloud moments.In the end, it's an average teen comedy that could have been so much more. If you want to see a genuinely funny comedy then see "There's Something About Mary" which is twice the movie this is.5/10.

Review title: 3rd Base is like Hot Apple Pie
Review_body: I thought is was a great Movie, But was Under Rate by many people, this movie is more of people late teens, 20's, 30's maybe 40's, i wouldn't sit my Grandparents in front of it.But the film its self is true, this all happens to the older teens, in many countries, i don't know about your country. the story line was the greatest, of one of the group says he lost his virginity by spending the night in the same room as one of the girls and which causes the Pact, in the end it was nothing more than talking.i have given this film 9/10 because i think it needed something else, but i not sure what though

Fans of this movie keep saying that people who dislike American Pie are easily offended snobs.  Trust me, sex violence and profanity are hardly offensive to me, and I've seen far more graphic film (my favorite movie is way more disgusting).  I am, however, offended by complete and unrelenting stupidity.  You can't image how glad I am that I got to see this for free. If I had payed, I would have never forgiven myself.  I didn't totally hate it, as I am a fan of Alyson Hannigan, but I would sooner swallow glass than recommend it to anyone other than despised enemies.  Oh yeah, I AM a teenager(17), and if there are humans that actually act like this, thank god I am smart enough to avoid them entirely.

Review title: Excellent movie!Great acting by all cast members. Totally cool gang of friends than be easily related to in this crazy world.
Review_body: This is a very real movie that the younger generation can relate to. It has a message to be learnt by all viewers. I think is really great that movie writers, producers and directors can take the time to bring to the big screen a very realistic topic that a lot of younger people are afraid to address.

Review title: They just do not make them like this anymore
Review_body:
Can you believe it has been 20 years since this film? It is still funny and amusing. The boys were boys, the girls were hot girls and had long hair and flaunted their bodies and the father was super cool.
Nowadays we have Daisy of Disney 'Star Wars' with short hair and looking all 'I have a chip on my shoulder' .. aaarrrgh I am going to stop right there.
American Pie is funny and you should watch it if you already have not.

Review title: The original... And definitely better than the others!
Review_body: The first American Pie is the best American Pie out there in my opinion! (and probably the best of teenage comedy).I watch it 100 times and I still laughing about their jokes and Jim (played by Jason Biggs) is a truly funny character with all his sex experiences and the advices that his father (Eugene Levy) gives to him, are awesome! Stifler (played by Sean William Scott) is also a very funny character! Shameless and he plays a real 'macho-men' very well. In spite of being a movie that doesn't have any brilliant performance and doesn't have any complexity that puts the actors in difficult situations, it's a pretty good film with lots of funny moments, lots of nudity, sex jokes and scenes, all the ingredients to make a very good teenage comedy!So, if you're a teenager with a tough 'sex life', watch this movie and you should learn something (or, at least, have a good laugh)!

I'm not sure why I rated this movie a 9 instead of 10 as it had me laughing from the opening moment to the last scene. The characters are perfectly cast, each with separate, distinct personalities reminiscent of some stereotype we all knew in High School. This film was written with a sensitive understanding what it is like to be in your later adolescent years and still exploring sex for the first moments. Clever, original, laugh out loud funny to a point you hate to see this great comedy end. Comedies are the most difficult of genre to do really well, but this one hits the mark. I sat there and enjoyed reliving a few moments of my own as I watched this great film. Worth enjoying for more than a single viewing.

Review title: Not my piece of pie (dur... I'm clever... )
Review_body: Anyone that calls this movie a classic should be shot.  Not once while watching this movie did I ever laugh.  I may have cracked a smile here or there, but I hardly consider a movie to be funny if all I'm doing is smiling.  Hell, I enjoyed the second movie much more so than this garbage (so much that I bought it... only to realize that I made a mistake, and therefore gave it away).  This movie reminds me of Road Trip, in that everyone gushes about how funny it is, and what a "classic" (a term thrown around all too often) it is... yet I don't find it funny in the least. The cast, with the exceptions of Sean William Scott and Eugene Levy are 100% worthless... especially Chris Kline.  Please, someone buy him some acting lessons.  The sight gags in the movie suck... flat out.  Looky, it's spooge... HAR HAR HAR.  Give me a break.  American Pie?  More like American Crap.1 star out of 10.

Man you know one day i turn the TV on at night (i was really young, 12 i think) and there it was starting the "American Pie". I don't really understand it by the time, it was just a funny movie, when i see it again by the age of 16, i knew that this movie was the funniest thing i ever have seen. All the boys in the world have passed for this phase, that's why this movie is so funny, is not something weird, it's just natural, and the scenes are amazing unexpected but they are a possibility. I laugh since the beginning till the end... Since that time i saw this movie a lot of times and i still laugh of the jokes, even more... The actors have a nice performance, especially Sean William Scott in Stifler's role...that really brings a "thing" to this movie that no other have...Tiago

I loved the Movie American Pie! It has a little something for everyone of every age and how to deal with lifes problems! It is a classic comedy, and a perfect cast! If your into 'Teen' Movies, this is a flick you gotta check out.
This is how high school really is. Great interruption of how life as an soon to be adult is.

If you want comedy then this is the film for you. This is a great film with powerful performances from Jason Biggs and my favourite Seann William Scott. A very funny comedy about 4 boys about to leave high school and are having a pact of loosing their virginity before they leave. But as any other comedy there's problems and funny occurrences in every minute. Exelant performances from Chris Klein and Thomas Ian Nicholas.... 10 out of 10 This is my favourite film. I don't know wot else to write so I'm just gaining to make words up jg fog coffeecake JFK Figaro joked Jase Fiji Garfield's AFC RFD;FAA diffused fractals fixed faked keyclick Jogjakarta Hui cleavage GIGO bog NH Hugh up hypo op p Gog Greg Gog;Hg Jogjakarta cofactor compactor Gertrud hr HRH Hts k hr hare h.

Even almost 20 years after release, you still can't say the words "this one time" without someone interrupting "at band camp!" So I figured it had to be a great movie, I was even so sold that I almost bought the second one at the same time (thankfully I didn't). Aside from a few cringe chuckles from Jim's totally awkward dad and the cameo from Blink 182, I really didn't enjoy watching this. Nothing too funny, just a whole lot of middle school humor. I really don't get why there's so many sequels and spin-offs from a rather bland film. Worth a watch if you've always been curious about some of the long running jokes from this movie, but nothing I'd watch a second time.

Review title: Without the movie series world would be boring bros
Review_body: Best movie series in the world. Alyson Hannigan is the cutest actress ever. Without the movie series world would be boring bros

I really liked this movie, i think that most high schoolers will relate. Jason Biggs is surprisingly good in this in my opinion, and i generally like the acting. Euegene Levy is awesome in this as well. I think you should go watch it. Definitely best movie of the whole franchise, including the spinoffs!

this movie made me relive my childhood...okay my childhood of watching teen movies that were older than me (Brat pack anyone...)  forget the mpa...let under 17s into this movie so they can enjoy it like i loved breakfast club, heathers, etc.  it's a learning experience

Review title: Don't believe the hype, it was pure 100% crap
Review_body: If you're 10 or simian, you might like this movie. For anyone with 1/2 a developed brain, it's not worth the time and money to sit through the vulgarities.

At first, when I heard a movie entitled 'American Pie' would hit the big screen, I Believed it would be about Buddy Holly's death(as was the song under the same title by Don McLean was about).   When I heard it was a sex comedy, I was offended, to say the least, and thought "Oh great, another "There's something about Mary"".   But, as i saw the film, I was even more offended.   It has to be one of the worst movies spewed out by Hollywood nowadays.   Whatever happened to the Noble movie?   Star Wars is one of the last refuges to the ideas that noble beliefs can still be shown on the Big Screen and still be entertaining, gripping, and interesting.And, what was even more offensive was in a commerical for 'American Pie', it had people singing 'How Sweet it is' to pies(something you'd have to watch the movie to understand).   I took it as a personal insult(the movie, and the commercial) against two songs in which I love(I hope Don and James hears about this outrage).   Take my advice, don't watch  'American Pie', go see Star Wars again, or rent 'Shawshank Redemption'.

Review title: a great movie for people of all ages
Review_body: If you think this movie is one that is only intended for the "hip" teen audience...think.  This movie offers some great laughs and good acting. The cast is basically made up of unknown teen actors (except for Natasha Lyonne and the girl who plays Willow on Buffy).  There are many great one-liners and it's packed full of hysterical situations.  From reviews that I have seen of this movie, a lot of people are comparing it to Fast Times at Ridgemont High.  I would say it's more like a Something about Mary about the teen dating scene rather than about thirtysomethings.  Anyone who appreciates good comedy and gutter humor should definitely see this movie.

I entered the theatre expecting another "There's Something About Mary" ripoff and it appeared as though that was exactly what I was getting -- another film filled with juvenile humour.  But something surprising happened.  After the first few scenes, "American Pie" became a smart and downright funny picture and I became caught up in the characters (how often does that happen in a comedy?).  The plot is surprisingly solid and, even more incredibly, relatively unpredictable, there are plenty of laughs, and, even though the ending is a little weak, I highly recommend this movie. It's much, much better than "There's Something About Mary" could ever dream of being.

Not only is this the funniest movie of 1999 (Austin Powers was good, but not this good), but you leave with a good feeling after watching it.  All the performances were solid, given the material they covered.  And even though the film revolves around teen-agers, I think you have to be in your twenties to truly appreciate the characters' take on their dilemma.  What also impressed me was how the pop music in the background fit each scene accordingly in tempo and mood.  Some people may be put off by some of the sight gags, but that's why it's rated R.

I just saw a sneak preview of this film, and it's difficult to try to place it.  It is definitely unlike the recent slew of teen movies that Hollywood seems to be churning out.  Why?  Well, for starters it has characters who each and every person can honestly relate to, not simply the caricatures which are so frequently featured on screen nowadays.  It has a couple of incredibly risque sight gags, one of which puts the infamous hair gel scene in "There's Something About Mary" to shame.  But the biggest reason it stands out is that it reminds me more of the classic 80's teen films (updated in content for the 90's, of course) than any of the cookie cutter 90's teen films have...by far.  This is "Fast Times at Ridgemont High" fixed up for a new generation.  It unabashedly deals with teenage hormones and masturbation, and is unafraid to show it.  Unlike the awful "Cruel Intentions", which tried to make teens appear over-experienced and sexy (failing miserably), "American Pie" beautifully illustrates the awkwardness and anticipation surrounding the loss of the big V and the trials of teen hormones and sexual frustration.  I highly recommend.  It'll have you rolling on the floor laughing, both from what's on screen and recognition of the humor of your own first time.

Review title: It's a fine piece of pie
Review_body: American pie was hilarious and a must-see for any teenage age guy.  I am not too sure if there is anymore room left on that proverbial envelope to push after this flick.  Although many teenage sexual urges and problems were exaggerated, the writers kept close to the adolescent experience.  I could relate to some of the characters, which made it all the more funny and captivating.  I'll have to see this again in the theater, but I might hesitate to see it on a date...especially a first.

In American Pie you can see how American movies are developing. And I think it's a good direction. No more movie makers are shamed to show what's underneath the bra. In Finland this movies was rated K-12 and I think that's good. More movies like this!

Review title: Laugh out loud, hysterical comedy for mature audiences only
Review_body: The funniest movie I've ever seen!  The entire audience at my theater's sneak preview was roaring.  this is for very mature teenagers and adults only.  Some of the one-liners were the best written ever for a movie. Very quick witted &  well written.  My only complaint is that the ending wasn't as good as the body of the movie.  It semed to fizzle.

This has got to be the funniest movie that I can remember seeing. It is only Sunday and I've seen this movie twice already! 3 minutes into the movie, the viewer knows it is going to be a great movie. Can't wait for the sequel (If you pay attention to the scene at the end in the diner, they leave it open for the possibility for a sequel in college)

If for some reason you just really, really, _really_ want to see this movie in theaters, then by all means do so. But, if you aren't sure if you can believe the hype on this movie, wait until its on video. In fact, wait until it's off the new release wall so you're only sinking two bucks into seeing it. Better yet, walk right on by the "A"s, and head straight for the "P"s, pick up Porky's, and go home. It will be the same premise, only executed far, far better. And since I'm turning this into a rant... Please, please, _please_ stop comparing this movie to "Something About Mary". (I'm a little leery of comparing it to "Porky's".) "Something..." was a well written, intelligent comedy that, while generously laden with "toilet jokes", did not use such humor as the foundation, purpose, and selling point for the movie. Take away the hair scene and you still have a love story. Take away the pie, and what do you have? Not much. Not much at all. Now that I'm done writing this, I've decided that, much like "Wing Commander", I just can't recommend that anyone see this movie. I can't have that on my conscience. ...Nah, I'm being too nice. This movie sucked. It sucked hard.

Review title: A hit for a teenager but a flop for an Adult.
Review_body: Four Young men explore the wonders and challenges of sex in this comedy about growing up. The story follows these men as they make a pact to loose their virginity before graduating high school and quickly learn that it is easier said than done.American Pie is a very raw and graphic film and can be disturbing at times. For most young adults the movie will come off as hilarious and good while most adults will find it repulsive and degrading. I sat in a theater between two other critics from another local media firm and a group of recent high school graduates. While one group cringed at the raw nature of the story the other cheered and yelled profusely. The movie completely butchers the idea of "love" and pushes on the idea of sex rules all. This movie will be a huge success among the young and a huge point of argument among the adults. If you have a week stomach i would not recommend this movie under any circumstances. On a scale from 1 to 5 tickets I would give this movie a 5 just because it depends on your age and maturity level whether you will like this movie or not.

American Pie, which is trying to capitalize on the success of the Farrelly Bros.'s There's Something About Mary, does an excellent job of living up to its predecessor.  American Pie tells a somewhat realistic, though very exaggerated, story of four high school seniors who make a pact to lose their virginity by prom night.  The appeal of this movie, much like with 'Mary,' is not the story, but the gross-out comedy.  And there is much of that in this film.  Still, the story is not lacking, and this film does present a sweet tale of friendship and the troubles of adolescence.  But the main reason to see this is for the great laughs and shock value, as it has plenty of both.

This is a definitely favorite for anybody that enjoyed There's Something About Mary.  But, even more than that, this movie is about high school, and how we all were and are.  The comedy is raunchy, but amazingly believable and funny.  The characters are very well developed and represent all the people from high school.  American Pie will truly go down as one of the classic high school movies and as one of the big hits of this summer.

A few words to describe American Pie: It is a fairly accurate portrayal of teenage life. It is not intended to impress the "critics" or to be clean. It uses the same language that many high school kids use and I believe most teenagers will be able to see their high school lives unfold on the screen before them. It essentially copes with the modern-day teenage life.

Review title: One of the best films in awhile
Review_body: American Pie is got to be one of the funniest movies of the year.  It is what kids all over the country try to do at one point in there life.  I have to say that I did not find the movie offensive like the reviews said. There where a lot of older people in the movie audience that where laughing as hard as I was.  The movie is not for younger people.  But I highly recommend it for anyone to see.

Review title: The funniest movie I have ever seen.
Review_body: Well that pretty much says it all for me!!!!!  I do not think I have seen a movie more funny than that one!!! That is all I am going to say other than go see it as soon as possible!!!

Review title: a hilarious documentary of teenage sexual angst
Review_body: Well, I too saw the sneak preview of this delightful movie positioned around the quest of four high school seniors to get laid before graduation.  If you think the premise is vulgar, then you may not want to read on, b/c this movie is not for you.  Not only does it put There's Something About Mary to shame with it's liberal use of bodily fluids, but it surpasses it through its hilarious performances and unforgettable scenes.  To put this movie in a nutshell would be to label it a documentary about teenage sexual angst. Needless to say, there are many things in this movie that resemble soft porn, minus the cheesy music and bad acting.  The movie does do a very good job of displaying the different attitudes towards sex and quite possibly (this may be a long shot) love through its use of great characterization. Chris Klein, last seen in Election, brings another genuine performance to the screen, along with Jason Biggs, who's new to me but obviously a pro already, and Thomas Ian Nicholas, a wide-eyed poster boy for Clearasil. But the standout performance, although small, has got to be Alyson Hannigan as a naughty nerd who provides the movie with its most memorable shock...believe me, you'll know once you see it.  Yes, the toilet humor is abundant, but the script is equipped with nonstop laughs and clever interludes.  If you enjoy comedies and aren't embarrassed by the sight of naked women and masturbation, then you have got to see this movie.

Review title: A standing ovation "10" for American Pie
Review_body: Now you might look at the score I gave this movie and think, "This guy's on crack".  However, let me explain myself.  I rate movies on what I expect them to deliver and how they match up to those expectations.  I expected this to be a teen-flick about sex that would be humorous at times, but nothing extraordinary.  I was so wrong.This movie was so much better than any teen comedy I have ever seen - and easily in my top ten comedies of all time behind Clerks, Caddyshack, etc. The entire theater was laughing hysterically through at least 50% of the movie.  The characters were believable - you know at least one person exactly like each of these characters.  They have the high school male sex drive pegged (along with the guy talk).  Eugene Levy could have been any of our dads - trying so hard to talk to his son candidly about sex, but failing miserably.Take my word for it.  This movie is ten times better than "There's Something About Mary".  My only regret is that I saw the Sneak Preview and have to wait a whole week before I can see it again.  I don't buy any movies on videotape, but I already have a space in my cabinet reserved for this one.
It was a hilarious movie that made me wish I was back in high school. Great, BELIEVABLE dialogue unlike other "Gen-X" movies like Nowhere and Clueless.

Review title: Pie, nor beer, will EVER taste the same again!
Review_body: "American Pie" is one of the FUNNIEST movies in a very long time. I don't think everyone will enjoy it, but if you need a few (make that a lot of) good laughs, you will love this film. When I left everyone was talking about coming back for more. They were also reciting the more memorable lines in the film. The cast did a great job as did the rest of the crew in producing a great piece of comedy that will attract many repeat viewers. One suggestion for those who have yet to view it, go with a group of friends, leave your mate at home!

I haven't laughed from the beginning of a movie all the way through in a very long time.  This movie was off the wall and shot the audience through a lot of unexpected comedy.  It almost went too far, but it was too funny to think that when it was over.

I watched this in a hotel alone the first time, laughed out loud until it hurt.  The second time was with four women.  I didn't think they would find it as funny as I did, but they proved me wrong.  They were in hysterics. I think it was funnier the second time.  Not sure if it was watching it with other people or what.  We had to rewind it several times because we were laughing too much, if that's possible.Very funny film. Four of Four Stars.

In an age where teen comedies are often toned down in order to get the "audience friendly" PG-13, it's always nice to see a raunchy R rated teen comedy, I would have loved to see the R rated cut of "Can't Hardly Wait." This movie is hysterical in so many different levels and somehow still manages to show a little heart.  You like these characters because they ARE you in high school.  The entire movie, however, is stolen by Allyson Hannigan in her only big scene at the end.  Quite a stitch!  Gotta love Willow.  A must see.

this is one of the few films I've seen all year where I have consistently laughed out loud and applauded. The only film I've seen where the whole audience applauded at the end (and not because they were glad it was over). There's nothing new here as far as story goes but the gags and delivery of jokes are priceless!

Review title: Twisted and gross, but very funny
Review_body: I thought American Pie was a compilation of many different films I've seen in the past all put together to make up the funniest movie I've seen since "Dumb and Dumber."  It had the gross humor of "There's Something About Mary" and the highschool setting of "Fast Times at Ridgemont High" just to name a few.  I thought the movie was well made and it was nice to see a fresh crop of young actors making such a surprising movie without needing a big name actor to bring in the publicity.  The content did that for them.  Thumbs up!!

"American Pie" is destined to become the "There's Something About Mary" of 1999.  With gross-out humor and good writing, this movie is very enjoyable and funny.  I suggest you see it before all of the jokes are ruined!

This was one of the few movies where I got out of the cinema and still had to laugh - this and "Beavis and Butthead". I know, it's a matter of taste, but this movie IS funny, when you don't look too sharp... and it has certainly a deeper meaning, there are some beautiful real-love scenes in it. Really good movie! btw. The first movie I rated 10/10

Review title: Provocative insight into the final weeks for four high school senior boys who form a pact to lose their virginity by prom.
Review_body: This movie is by far the most entertaining film I have seen in quite some time.  Not since Fast Times at Ridgemont High has thier been such an extrordinary look into the complexities of high school life.  This movie truly reminds me of how my days in high school ended.  If you can laugh at a tad bit raunchy joke then this movie will bring you to your knees.  A young talented cast deserves credit for such a fine display of acting.  The only sad bit is the portrayal of the sport of lacrosse.  But since the setting is Michigan, we'll let it slide.  By the way Michigan State recently dropped its lacrosse program so there is a bit of a blunder there.

Review title: This movie beats austin powers and Big Daddy hands down.
Review_body: I was laughing practically from start to finish during this movie.  I had high hopes of this movie being hilarious and usually I get let down, but not this time.  The humor is a little on the twisted side but that is what is great about it.  Movies before hinted about the subjects but this one takes it head on.  There is also a few life lessons hidden behind the humor.  It is a must see if you like to laugh.

I can't believe he porked a pie!  I saw this with my girl, who despises the recent proliferation of teeny-bopper films as much as I, and we had a ball. Though we both were nursing terrible hangovers, we laughed ourselves to tears throughout the film.  I can't remember laughing so much at a movie while sober, and I don't think I've ever seen her laugh so hard outside of a pool hall.  Though the film took the discovery and yearning for fornication to absurdity, it's best not to search for any profundity here.  This is a fun film, so sit back and enjoy it.  And don't worry when the film begins to recede into kitsch morality and sensitivity, for you are saved at the moment of finally dismissing the movie by the band-camp girl.  This is an audience participation film, though, so watch it with a good one.

American Pie is the funniest movie I've ever seen! It was awesome, and I'd see it a million times! The cast is awesome, and it deals with teens today. Everyone must see it. I love it! American Pie is the best movie!

I originally went to this movie because I wanted to see Jason Biggs act. If I went again, it would be because I loved the movie itself. It's more than just a shock-show of toilet humor. It's actually full of lessons on life and love. I was pleasantly surprised at Oz(Chris Klein)'s transformation. I laughed and nodded my head at the heroes' mistakes. I could empathize with them. Although it's naturally a little exaggerated, being a comedy and all, it's pretty honest about what goes on in high school. And more than making me laugh, it made me think. It doesn't hurt that just about all the actors were stunningly good-looking either. :) I definitely recommend this movie for parents as well as teens over 16. You'll love it and learn from it.

I'll never look at an apple pie the same way again!!!! Lots of unexpected and surprising laughs arise out of situations which could happen to any of us. Eugene Levy is perfectly cast as the father of a typical horny teenager living vicariously through his son. Dads of teenage sons should see this movie to give them the inspiration and confidence to talk to their sons about sex. Gives a whole new meaning to the term "pale ale"!

This is quite easily the best movie I've seen all summer. I'm 17 and I don't care what anyone says, this movie is real...really funny. Adults can't quite grasp the fact that this is what life is like, in fact this movie is only a tame version of todays teenager. I love it and if you live in the states, it is for sure worth sneaking in to, if you are under age.

Review title: This movie is one of the best comedies of the year!!
Review_body: Going to see American Pie, I was thinking of all the funny trailers on TV, and was looking forward to a good time.  But the movie exceeded all my expectations, as not only was this a comedy, it was one to which almost anyone could relate, and see themselves in one of the film's characters. There are several unforgettable scenes, which will no doubt become classics, but the main objective of the movie, along with providing gut-busting laughs, is to present a message that one is free to make his own decisions and to disregard peer pressure.  I'm not going to spoil the movie for those who have not seen it yet, because some of the jokes are funny only when seen for the first time, but the jist of it is: YOU HAVE TO SEE AMERICAN PIE if you like to laugh and are any kind of movie buff.  It's also a great film to bring a date to.

Review title: Surprising, hysterical trip back to high school
Review_body: Sure, its crude.  Yeah, its juvenile.  But its absolutely hilarious.  I went to see it without having seen any movie trailers, and that made a HUGE difference.  Everything was a surprise.  After seeing the movie, I did watch a trailer, and was glad I missed it before.  It gave everything away!Even if you have seen the trailer, go see the movie.  It is fun

Probably the funniest slapstick movie of the year! I laughed out loud non-stop! The story follows the attempts of 4 high school guys trying to lose their virginity before they graduate. Their antics are ridiculous but funny! Sure some scenes, like the pie scene or the "stuff" in the beer scene, were nasty and extremely distasteful.  But the movie had strong performances and a hilariously entertaining script. Shannon Elizabeth is the highlight of the film!  It comes across as a "guy flick" but I think both genders would enjoy the film. I strongly recommend this film to anyone who isn't offended by some extremely distasteful content.

American Pie is the best movie ever! It has everything you need to have a perfect movie. And Shannon Elizabeth's breasts are amazing!!! I recommend this movie to everyone who has seen Porky's and if you haven't go see American Pie and then go rent one of the Porky's movies. I am buying this movie the moment it goes on sale!!

Review title: American teenage humor at its best.
Review_body: American Pie is an excellent comedy that has every aspect of real high school life, as a view of sex.  I would recommend this film to anyone who enjoys the humor related to not-by-choice virgins. I think everyone can relate to one or more of the characters represented in this film.

This is a very funny, funny, funny, funny, funny movie, oh hang on, I think I may have already said that..... Ummm now where was I?  Oh yes, this is a funny movie. As Jason Biggs said in a recent Australian interview, "People like to be shocked," and I think if you want to be shocked, you should definetely see this movie.  It is truly a shocker, but only in the good sense.I've been waiting to see this movie since I don't know how long, and like so many other movies that dissapoint you when you finally see them after a long, long, long wait, this one didn't. I'll admit, I was mainly wanting to see Alyson Hannigan (Tell me, am I the only one here that watches Buffy the vampire slayer, for Willow?  She's just such a cute character.) But she certainly doesn't turn out to be the cute little Willow character that we all know and love, which was quite interesting, and shocking to see.  I was going to use the quote: "And this one time, at band camp..." but seeming someone else has already gone and done that, I won't... (Well, it would appear that I already have.  Oh well, you get that don't ya?)Well, I can't help myself, I have to say it again..... funny, funny, funny, funny, funny.....And as the saying goes.... "If you only see one movie this year...."  well who cares how the saying goes, see what ever movies you want to see, just make sure you don't miss out on this one......Truly a 12 out of 10 effort.Thank you for your time.Nick.

American Pie was a great movie, I was really surprised by it. Alyson Hannigan (Michelle) was amazing even though she had a small part. Jason Biggs was also hilarious. I was afraid the movie would be cheesy, but instead it was funny, raunchy,honest, and intelligent.  It was one of the best movies this summer.

Review title: A good film reflecting teens sexuality issues
Review_body: American Pie is a great movie. Why? I'll try to explain... When I first saw the film i laughed at the scenes where Jim was discovering his own sexuality, or lack thereof. But if you think about it for a second, isn't that the problem of many, many American teens nowadays? Adults are constantly proclaiming that sex is bad, something you should stay away from until you are at least 67! I so very often see adult Americans tell their mid-puberty-hormones-going-wild teen kids to stay away from all things fun, and not to forget - natural. "We accept the world presented to us" Ed Harris said in The Truman Show, and I agree to that. If I were told all my life that blue actually is red - I would believe it, but that doesn't make it right. American Pie shows us all that sex is a problem teens struggle with, and it is the parents obligation and privelidge to assist and guide their children. A very important point here is "guide", it's better to tell your children "how to" rater "not to", I believe. "Man shaped in Gods vision" ring a bell? Just kidding. We need more reality in films, especially American films. Even a comedy like American Pie can have an important story to tell, and I believe this film gived it a very good try, perfect I'd say. Today's society needs some "Grrrr" and "Swinging, baby" as a great british spy would say! So my final comment is that American Pie is a great film, very funny, the actors do a good job portraying young frustrated, scared and real teenagers longing for "love". It makes a good point which can be helpful in life, for both parents and children. Is it dangerous to tell kids that sex is allright? No! Love and sexuality is a great thing! And it's important.

American Pie has got to be the funniest movie ever made. I thought Happy Gilmore was but this movie just kicks arse!!!! It has the spunkiest bunch of blokes ever- Oz, Jim and Kevin. I walked out of the cinema totally in love with the guys and still in tears from some of those scenes like the first sock scene, the pie scene and the music scene where Oz says "it came from the heart". The story line is very clever and everyone involved with the film should be proud. Ever since i saw it 3 days ago all the punch lines have been going through my head and all my friends keep talking about it and we laugh ourself silly. I loved it so much that i am going to see it again and again and as soon as it comes out on video i am buying it. Everyone go out and see it because it is the best movie i have ever seen.....shocking and graphic but excellent.

Review title: could this movie suck any more?
Review_body: hey guys I have an idea, let's make the worst movie ever made! cool how about we take four unsympathetic characters have them say the words "f**k" and "sex" a thousand times over and then throw in some poo poo humor to satisfy the nine-year-olds in the audience.very original!

Watched it with very low expectations as I hadn't heard or seen much about it but really enjoyed it.  Didn't know any of the actors or actresses but they all seemed to act well and all played easily likeable characters, especially the foreign student!

I'm surprised to see that females rated this movie higher than males. For any man who's not ashamed of his teenage years this has got to be one of the funniest movies ever.  Because it fits my generation a little better, I think its an even better high school comedy than "Fast Times at Ridgemont High"!

Review title: Safe at home with the dvd
Review_body: When I first caught the trailers for American Pie I thought that it was going to be too crude.  There was no doubt that this film would make Something About Mary seem like a Disney flick.  But now, in the comfort of my own home, having just witnessed the DVD version of American Pie, I have to say that it is an excellent movie.  Having been raised on films by the Zucker brothers and Mel Brooks, that's a difficult statement to make.  But those movies were the early stages of making sex a comedic subject, and American Pie is the next step in the evolutionary chain.  I'm sure I was as shocked at some scenes as the previous generation were at segments of Airplane! or Blazing Saddles.It's difficult to believe that this is the Weitz brothers first film.  The story flowed extremely well, particularly over the raciest subject matter. And the cast is superb.  Had the screenplay been handled with less finesse, or the lines read with less youthful innocence, I'm certain this would have been a movie to avoid.  But instead I found it a great escape.Eugene Levy was the only cast member I recognized from previous roles, and he did a very credible job as the loving father awkwardly attempting to help his boy pass into manhood.I would strongly recommend American Pie to any of my friends interested in comedy films.>

Review title: This movie goes much deeper than it appears.
Review_body: Before watching this movie, I thought it would be a lot like "There's Something About Mary;" overly crude, real in your face, with a lot of stupid acting characters in it.  Somewhat enjoyable, but not as funny as others made it out to be.  However, I was greatly surprised to find this an excellent teen movie.  On the surface, there are the cruder aspects of teenage years: sex and bathrooms.  But when you actually watch this movie, instead of dismissing at as a gross-out film, you will notice the excellent direction of the Weitz brothers, the small details that they put into each character that make them more than the caricatures so common in movies today.  Every actor contributes to that effort by really getting into the mindset of a graduating HS senior.  The maturing of each character is evident and encouraging.  See this movie with an open mind, and you will be thoroughly entertained.

Review title: To Be Honest, I Liked "Porky's" Better.
Review_body: "American Pie" takes a strikingly original premise and makes several interesting twists and turns with it. That is: A bunch of teenage boys want to get laid and end up getting caught in a few embarassing situations as a result.No, there isn't a lot to this movie--indeed, it is an updated "Porky's"-type movie, with the exception that the characters in Porky's were better developed and this movie takes place at a high school only and with no real central conflicting "Porky"-type villain.To the movie's credit, there are several great laughs in it--the jokes are in general quite original. It's just that they do not add together into anything of substance.

User_name: M u r p h y
Review_body: What a great film. I recommend it, especially the Region 1 DVD Unrated Version. The film is hilarious, and some of the things that happen within the film ....The best DVD available at the moment, excluding the Matrix. Lots of extra's including out takes and a version useful music thing. That allows you to play the soundtrack within the film.Great, watch it today.

Review title: Closer to the truth than most people want to admit...
Review_body: American Pie is closer to the truth than most people want to admit. Anyone who pans this movie is probably doing so because they either forgot what it was like to be a teenager or grew up in a convent.Of course certain scenes are exaggerated, but that is what movie making is all about. Real-life events are stretched out to the extremes of believability.I don't know about you, but I've made similar pacts with friends, spied on good looking women, and still turned out fine. Loosen up people, this is a very funny movie.

When I first saw this movie in theaters, I thought it was the greatest movie ever made. As some of you can tell by this, I am a teenager. I watched it a few times when it came out on video, and for the most part, it was equally as good. A lot of older people might not like this movie, but it is an excellent portrayal of high school students today and a laugh-a-second movie. Jason Biggs is great as Jim, but Eugene Levy and Seann William Scott have to be the funniest characters as Jim's father and Stiffler respectively. Nadia and Vicky are hot, and it's hard to believe that Thomas Ian Nicholas could go from pitching for the Cubs as Henry Rowengardener in 'Rookie of the Year' to orchestrating Sex Bible secrets as Kevin in 'American Pie' in what seemed like such a short time. If you liked 'Can't Hardly Wait', 'She's All That', or 'Porky's', you will like this ten times better. Probably my favorite movie; 9.5/10.

When I saw this movie last summer in Boston, I did not know what to expect at all. To say the least, I was positively surprised! Featuring an almost unknown cast, American Pie makes for good fun. The story about about the four guys trying to "score" is extremely entertaining when you see how much they try to be successful in their quest for losing their virginities. I recommend this to everyone between the ages 15 - 55!

Review title: I liked this movie better the first time...
Review_body: ...when it was called "Porky's."  All I can say is that the only reason to see this film is to find out what all the hype is about.  It's great humor for a 13 year old, who, unfortunately, is probably too young to see the film anyway.

Review title: A hilarious take on sex and high school for today.
Review_body: This movie is a hilarious romp through the maze of adolescence and the pressures of sex.  It captures the awkward, the funny, the moving, and inquisitive side of being a teenager.  Despite its raunchiness, this movie has an emotional core that is more about growing up and love than it is about getting another notch on the belt.

Review title: Perfect choose of characters! Everybody in the right place!
Review_body: I just figured it out that everybody was chosen very carefully after watching the movie for the 2nd time. Every character was appearing right in time and in the correct place. In addition, the movie is telling the truth of life in a fantastic voice. It's really a masterpiece in my idea. It takes you back to the world we all lived in for some years. "Guys! The big dance AND graduation are coming up and we still HAVE TO get laid." Jim (Jason Biggs) is a bright but socially inept guy whose despair at being a virgin only increases his foolishness. He gets little help from his dad (Eugene Levy); his ideas of sex lectures are to thumb through a copy of Hustler magazine with his son. When Jim's using his webcam, the movies reaches its climax. He's playing professionally like a real virgin. The part he's trying to make his hair the way girls like is realistic. However, along the way, a few lessons are learned, and at least a few of the boys' questions are answered, balancing most of the film's vulgarity. The best characters used in real romantic scenes, were Mena Suvari and Chris Klein. Their appearance was one of my personal favorites which was played professionally in this movie. It's the most amuzing sex comedy I have ever reviewed, with the perfect use of a vast variety of different characters.-Ahmad Anvari, Movie Reviewer - Tehran, Iran

American Pie is one of those films that you can watch from start to finish, without feeling bored or wanting to fast forward it. From the start of the film where you see the main character bumbling dork Jim, try hopelessly to get the girl he likes to notice him, to the finish in which Finch gets the girl nobody in there right mind would expect, the whole film is one gigantic chuckle-fest.Laugh it up as you follow the four guys, Jim, Kevin, Finch and Oz, and feel pity and amusement as they make a pack to loose there virginity before prom.One of the highlights of this film is the hysterical Stifler. Most of his sentences include swearing, and he thinks hes god gift. But not everything turns out the way he plans. And thats all I'm saying about him ;) Anyway if you like rude jokes, stupid situations and teenage comedies as a whole, then check this film out! The king of all teen comedies, with a marvellous second and third film as well! ****/*****

This movie is absolutely hilarious and yet at the same time depicts to an extent what teenagers are like in High School.  Jim and his buddies are typical High School seniors in that they want to not be virgins before graduation.  All of them had a great performance, including Jim's dad. Yet I warn that ANYONE who is not open about the subject of sex need not see this.  Otherwise, enjoy this movie.
Where to watch this full movie? Its only 30 second trailer in here. This app is spoiled

Review title: The film that rules whole type.
Review_body: American Pie is one of the most successful teenage-film about four last class students trying to get laid before the school ends. What makes this movie very funny and popular is all the situations where the characters are confused.For example the situation of "Extra light beer". American Pie is the "father" of the newer films, such as "Road Trip", "100 Girls", and others. If you are a teenager, this is a must-see film for you!Don't miss it! P.S. I hope American Pie 2 will be as good as the first one, because the first one had been the number one here in Lithuania for longer than 2 months!

Review title: Its the best comedy movie i ever seen
Review_body: Its the best comedy movie i ever seen.. its reminding me of my school childhood..

Review title: fantastic and smart movie, misunderstood by dumb people
Review_body: Most people think this movie is just another coming of age teen movie with an abundance of toilet humor. While that is partially true, if you're smart you can look deeper and realize that this movie is actually pretty deep and clever social commentary. In the same way that South Park uses crude humor to make fun of current events, this movie makes fun of many current events. There are many examples of satire in this movie and that is why its my favorite movie ever.Unfortunately this film is often misunderstood by un smart people and that is sad. But don't be an idiot when you see this, because you should see this movie its fantastic and funny, but analyze it and realize that there is more to this movie than you realize at first.

When i think about films I've watched and what i think are good ones and bad ones i have to say this comes close to the top in good films.This film has to be the first film which shows what teen life is like. OK in some bits it is crude but this is aimed at a teen audience so teens do not really care if something is crude because it is normal in their lives. The characters and actors are alike in ways and the directors really worked hard with them to get the audience a real experience of teen life.Basically you have gotta group of teens who all want to get laid on prom night. You basically watch them make these plans and watch as they all go wrong. Sit back and enjoy but really they should have stopped after American pie 3.

Review title: good film -- more than meets the eye
Review_body: Crude, rude, crass, sophomoric and predictable at times, American Pie is carefully crafted to appeal to a range of audiences.  But whatever you can say about it, for me the whole thing works!I do not think you can view this movie as simply the exposition of late 20th century mores viewed through the lens of the average hormonally driven American male.  Rather it is at once and the same time an exposition about expectation.  The expectation of the time after high school, of relationships, of new found physicality, of intimate expression, of going forward into the future.Herz and Weitz craftily use the testosterone enriched environment of high school as the vehicle on which to carry this theme.  While many characters in literature and cinema have embarked on their own search for truth, American Pie is more about the embarkation upon the journey than the journey itself.The theme is repeated over and over again, and subtly (as distinct from the crassness of much of the movie) reinforced through out the film.  The journey is presented in the choices of colleges, the coach's speech at the lacrosse game, the `bus' to the prom night party and the duet sung by Heather and Chris.  It is expressed most poignantly by the characters of Vicky and Kevin when they recognize that while they have each consummated there love their futures will lead them to something different than they had envisioned just hours before.The late teen years are perhaps the only moment in time when the future potential of each of us is present in such abundance and so readily convertible into present achievement.If you are young (a late teen) and you watch this movie consider how this movie presents a modern parable to you about all the future potential you have before you and how this moment is a but a temporary gift, to be used and enjoyed before it becomes the prevailing present.If you are older, allow the magic of celluloid and the fine craft of the writer, director and actors to transport you back to a time when the future beckoned and each experience was as new as that spring day on which this movie begins.

Let me start out saying that (at the time of writing) I am an 18 year old American Male which from what I gather would normally be in the target audience. Watching this movie was not by my choice but rather my parents put it on when it was on TV.There are just so many things wrong with this movie I don't even know where to start. Basically the premise is that these four "boys" make a pact to have sex before graduating high school which is already extremely absurd. And the comment about penises unused is just plain nonsense unless they never urinate?Most of the scenarios are incredibly unlikely and just plain ridiculous. For example the scene where Jim convinced Nadia to change her clothes at his house and she just starts MASTURBATING in his bed. Really?? WHO goes into someones bedroom believing they are just down stairs and does that? Nobody. And what the hell was with the "Are you ready for a partner?" portion between Jim and his Dad?? The characters also had no depth or much defining characteristics and in general were just plain unlikeable. It was to the point that I often forgot who was who which is not a good sign for a movie.Another thing is I did not agree with the message that this movie was displaying. Basically just saying everything is always about sex and that it is all that matters in a relationship. Reinforcing the pressure for people to engage in that type of activity more or less as young as possible. I found the movie disgusting on many accounts because it was just too crude and found it hard to watch within the first 20 minutes. The part early on where Jessica says to Vicky "It's not a space shuttle launch, it's sex." is a perfect example of the wrong attitude.I had very few actual laughs (perhaps three in total) other than laughs of embarrassment rather than actually being funny. It would have been a pure bore if it were not so disturbing.And the ending was by far the worst. Although in some ways "Oz" was admirable for becoming more sensitive and caring but still unlikeable nonetheless. The sex scenes were nothing other than highly unpleasant to watch. And to top it off the part where Kevin(?) and Vicky decided they could not make it ended up making me sad. So at the end of the movie I ended up sad and disgusted from the previous scenes.Personally I don't want to end up feeling like crap at the end of movies.So to summarize: If you are looking for something funny or good or even decent. STAY CLEAR of this movie. It is not good.If you really want to see a "teen" oriented movie, at least watch something good like Back to the future.If you are looking for something funny, there are plenty of other choices that will give real laughs.

Review title: Not many teen movies can be watched more than once, this can
Review_body: I watched and loved this when it came out, I remember it being side splitting funny. Now re-watching watching it 6 years later while in my 30s I was pleasantly surprised that it hadn't lost it's charm, and the jokes were still funny. I didn't split my sides like I did the first time but that's often the case when you have high expectations. Yes much of the jokes are gross out, but not to the extent of the films that followed that really have taken it too far. The dialogue is well written and in many cases rings true from my experiences at high school. Tthere are very few jokes that miss the mark, and the sound track is great as well. Highly recommended.

Review title: stupid tasteless boys' movie, with an extremely one-sided view on girls and women
Review_body: Stupid boys' movie, with an extremely one-sided and discriminating way of seeing girls, as either "hot babes" or "geeks". It's about teenage-boys trying to loose their virginity. You can imagine how plot goes on, while the boys try to get laid. Lots of goofy jokes and primitive comedy below the belt. No sophistication once so ever. The title is referring to how doing it with a pie apparently is supposed to feel like being with a girl. Which of course end up in a scene where the leading role "borrows" one of his moms warm pies and of course gets caught. In general I will not recommend the movie. I find it extremely discriminating and just plain stupid and a waste of time. Very tasteless.

American Pie is a classic coming of age story about four boys who can't stand the idea of graduating high school as virgins. This movie contains a lot of crude sexual humour that is obviously not suitable for young children but it may come across the wrong way to certain non-open-minded adults. As most movies have sex scenes these days, this movie actually contains two oral sex scenes (although obviously no sensitive body parts are shown: no worries for the littluns, but why would they be watching anyway)?The film is low-budget, but the story flows well and the characters are down to earth (and so damn funny!) Seann William Scott is absolutely head-over-heals hilarious as the obnoxious Steve Stifler. If you own the DVD or VHS, you may want to rewind and view some of these priceless Stifler scenes over and over again:1.) Stifler asks if the boys are coming to his party.2.) Stifler greets Vicky, Jessica and Sherman at the party.3.) Stifler comments on Oz' failed attempt to hook up with a college girl (party).4.) Stifler has some pale ale (party).5.) Nadiavision (the monkey adds to this one).6.) Oz practising his duet in the showers after lacrosse and Stifler's response.7.) Stifler's revenge on Finch (Finch in the can).There are more, but those are all I can remember.Eugene Levy plays Jim's "open about sex" father. I felt that his embarrassing discussions with Jim were not funny to say the least (though they were intended to be), but some people liked them.Tara Reid is her usual "hot" self in this movie, and Natasha Lyonne looks good as well.The acting is not as horrible as people say. Chris Klein's (Oz) lines seemed a little forced in some places, but he made up for them with some of his other scenes.This movie can be watched over and over again and enjoyed as much as the very first time. If you enjoy sexual humour (which most of us do: some won't admit it though), this is the movie for you.This movie was followed up by two sequels that I'm sorry to say were not very good, but they are worth watching just to see what Stifler will do or say next.The unrated DVD of American Pie has a crapload of bonus features, so as Ferris Bueller would say:"If you have the means, I highly recommend picking one up!"

Aside from being an extremely funny movie, the friendship dynamic shown by the four main characters made this movie. Although #2 may have been funnier, the story line was much better. Sean William Scott as "Stifler" was by far the most humorous in the film, and should have had more face time. His facial expressions, tone and lines were all hilarious. He played the dumb jock/player perfectly. This was one of the best characters I have ever seen in any film. All four main characters were very good in their roles. Eddie Kaye Thomas as "Finch" was another great character. The dynamic between him and Stifler throughout the film were extremely entertaining. "Oz" was the most suave of the four, but lacked in the comedy department. Eugene Levy played the awkward dad very well. Although "Kevin" was somewhat annoying at times, his final scene with Tara Reid added just about the only drama element, and anyone who has had their heart broken can empathize with him. This film will become the next "Animal House" and be a required college flick.

But , having spent a half hour on the first part of the "American Pie" , I do not regret !Every moment of the film resembles the modern teenage society that young people care about these days. Each of the main characters I easily recognized himself and his friends. For this movie is a huge plus .The humor of the film at the highest level, the mass is very funny and amusing moments.Also worth noting is the incredible acting. Actors chosen perfectly. Hard to imagine that the role of Jim decides someone better Jason Biggs - relaxed and calm in dealing with friends, it is closed in conversations with girls. An excellent job with their roles , Chris Klein, Thomas Ian Nicholas and Eddie Kaye Thomas . But a separate credit goes to Seann William Scott , who gave the film a whole new mood.Many may think that the AP has attracted only by his vulgar jokes , but this is not the case. The plot of the film is excellent , it is not just the story of how the guys wanted to have sex, but about the fact that the world beyond that there is a real genuine love .I think my estimate is obvious : 7\10

One day , one ordinary American school, several of the same ordinary guys decide to lose their virginity . They decided to do it before the finish school . Business, so to speak, is not easy. Perhaps not everyone is able to do , because on the way to the cherished dream is a wide variety of obstacles.Initially , I expected to see in the " American Pie " is much worse spectacle. But the opposite happened . This movie I really liked . Such pictures as this shot very much, but it is the " American Pie " is considered the founder of the genre "youth porn comedy ." It already gives this film more flavor."American Pie" - it's really very nice , cheerful and funny comedy . Level vulgarity here , of course, rolls over, but the "American Pie " is forgivable , because toilet humor here is practically his chip if you want."American Pie" was the directorial debut for Chris and Paul Weitz . They are definitely a very successful debut in the movie, albeit with a rather peculiar film. Chris and Paul rented a very good youth comedy that really could become a classic.The main roles are played by Jason Biggs , Seann William Scott, Chris Klein , Thomas Ian Nicholas , Eddie Kaye Thomas, Mena Suvari , Tara Reid , Shannon Elizabeth , Alyson Hannigan . All fun played their characters, but the most memorable Jason Biggs and Seann William Scott.Subtotal: funny teen comedy and fun , and definitely a classic.

A 6.8 rating for this movie is ridiculously low...I don't think I've seen this much hostility towards a movie in quite a while. I don't remember the IMDb being the hotbed for PC, prudish people to spout their moral qualms. What is clear, however, is this: this post will do nothing to change people's minds about the movie, so rather than try to convince people that this movie was freaking awesome, I will attempt to sum up where the appeal is.The claims of some of its detractors are true. The movie relies heavily on crude humor (very much in the mold of Something about Mary, which also started off with a 1-star rating by some prude), but very accurately reflects the type of conversations that teens have. Example: Jim, walking into school, says to Kevin "I saw the Little Mermaid last night. That Ariel, she's so hot." C'mon, what 17 year old kid hasn't thought that? What sets the movie apart from others in recent memory, though, is the heart with which it is done. The accuracy in the conversations and the way the people deal with the issues that always arise during that time in a person's life is fantastic and, as a result, gives the movie-viewer a powerful sense of nostalgia for those days when the struggles of life seemed impossible, but were so fun at the same time.Who will like this movie? People who are young at heart, people who are wasted, and people who want to be transported back to a great period in their lives. Prudish people- pretension need not apply.As one prude worries, "in 10 years, I fear this may be a cult classic." Too late. Awesome movie.

Review title: A funny accurate look at High School life for guys.
Review_body: American Pie is one of the many great films of the 90's. It goes into the minds of high school teens and shows whats really goes on. With its awkward funny moments and lovable characters this is a must see. You can relate all the characters to you and your buddies back in High School. Although it has a very loose plot it makes up for it with its hilarious scenes of what guys think sex should be and how much they want it. I kept wanting more and it kept delivering more great humor. It also includes a good romance scene or two. I recommend this for anyone who likes their humor with some nudity and perverted actions. On the other hand it has some cheezy jokes and some bad displays of acting. Its almost hard to notice the mistakes in this film because you are trying to maintain control of yourself as your cracking up. Jason Biggs delivers a great performance as Jim Levetstein, the nervous guy who isn't so lucky with girls. I could relate to so many of the characters on so many levels, and i think you will too. 3 stars

Review title: simply the greatest film i have ever seen
Review_body: THIS FILM changed my life!!!!! I come home everyday and throw on American pie and it never fails to make me feel great. In terms of film-making there is nothing to fault, fantastic acting, a hilarious script and inspired direction all add up to the greatest film ever brought down to earth from heaven. It truly is god's gift to serious movie-goers, such as myself, finally a film that does not talk down to individuals. I seriously think this film should be shown on a large screen in any country with social or political unrest and the light hearted comedy would really sort everyone out. I'm watching American pie on my telly as I write this thanking god that I have the absolute pleasure to be alive at the same time as such a masterpiece of film-making. It truly deserved its thirteen Oscar nominations as well as its prestigious "film of the millennium" awarded by the UN. Go watch it now and feel yourself grow as a person!!!!!

Review title: Not A Bad Movie At All
Review_body: The first American Pie is a teenage comedy on the top movie list in 1999, but it's not the best of the seven American Pie series. For me, I preferred the second one, as everyone was more relaxed and knew each other, making the movie better. Don't get me wrong, this one certainly had it's funny moments, but in my estimation it wasn't as good as the second one. American Pie is a classic teen comedy about sex and it inspired a new era in comedy that's still relevant today. It has the crazy and good looking youth we see in today's comedy, but unfortunately also has some really lame jokes and bad acting, that thankful went out with the nineties.If you hadn't seen this movie yet you should see it right now. I'm not convincing you guys to watch it if you don't like teen movies but its classic of this kind of comedy. This might look little bit weird because its like a "Weird comedy".Actually, they aren't weird at all it's very hard to create comedy like this and make a movie like this. But I hardly recommend this movie if you are looking for different kind of comedy something opposite from teens movie like good rated movie with good well known actor and a good storyline or a family comedy because it would be pretty weird watching movies with your children or with your parent. This movie is way different about teenagers life, and their jokes. I could say this was one of the best of this kind of comedy i have ever seen. if someone asks for a comedy movie, i always told them to watch American pie. This movie would be best if you're looking for something really easy and very hilarious to watch as I said already.

when i started watching this i was like yawn!!!! but then it got good!!!! i would recommend it to anyone at any age people wanted to ban it!!! that is crazy it is rated 15 or R for a reason so people underage cant see it. so if you haven't seen it go and rent it or buy it. you are missing out on so much!!!! i mean i have watched like 20 million times and I'm still love it. 10 out of 10 first class stuff man. i love the pie!!!!!!!!! and if u haven't seen it get a piece of it u will not regret it!! i was laughing so much wen i first watched it i instantly knew it was one of the best films i have ever seen and i had already seen scary movie!!1 all the characters are so cool (even the band geeks).
